H0.text: Speciation is the process that is the source of the wide color variation observed in parakeet populations, whose basic plumage color is green but exhibit a wide range of color both in the wild and in captivity.

H1.text: Adaptation is the process that is the source of the wide color variation observed in parakeet populations, which are birds with basic green plumage that show a wide range of color both in the wild and in captivity.

H2.text: Natural selection is the source of the wide color variation observed in parakeet populations, which are birds whose basic plumage color is green yet exhibit a wide range of colors both in the wild and in captivity.

H3.text: Genetic mutation is the process that causes the wide color variation observed in parakeet populations, which are birds whose basic plumage color is green but exhibit a wide range of color both in the wild and in captivity.

A6.text: Random mutations are the ultimate source of genetic variation.

A7.text: Other mechanisms, such as genetic drift, contribute to it, as well.

A8.text: Males with the brightest plumage are favoured by females of multiple species of bird.
